nodes.bodyText:
We need to do something about this - it breaks every time the version # changes.  I wonder if the default code can be updated to actually look for a pattern:  ../app/target/apicurio-registry-app-$VERSION-runner.jar
Not something that is relevant to this PR, just an observation. :)  I'll open a ticket.
Yeah, was thinking the same ... @Frawless any idea?
Not sure if it's possible to get it from pom somehow. Maybe it could be parsed (it's xml) and get it from there. We do something similar in Strimzi.
We could just use some file system code to search a directory for a file of the right pattern.
This change loses the test method name from the topic name.  That seems like potentially useful debugging information lost - do we not care?
For topics I guess we could leave it, for artifactIds it needs to be something unique, as now we get 2 runs of the same test - non-cached vs cached client.
Here too - we're going to be losing potentially important context info.  Perhaps a variant of these generate methods that can take a string to use as part of the name?
Nah, this doesn't pose any useful info, at least it didn't for me.
